externalDocs.description: See documentation for Akamai's CP Codes and Reporting Groups API

info.title: Akamai: CP Codes and Reporting Groups API

get.description: Lists detailed information about CP codes available within your account and contract.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's CP Codes and Reporting Groups API

200.description: Lists details of CP codes available for a specified account and contract.

schema.description: Provides details about the CP codes available for your contract.

cpcodes.description: A collection of CP codes available for your contract.

items.description: Provides detailed information about a CP code.

accessGroup.description: A group that controls access to specific CP codes.

contractId.description:
Identifies the contract assigned to the access control group. Get and store this ID from your account using the [Contracts API](https://techdocs.akamai.com/contract-api/reference/get-contract-ids).

**Note**: See [ID prefixes](https://techdocs.akamai.com/cp-codes/reference/id-prefixes) for guidance on comparing this value with data from PAPI.

groupId.description:
Identifies the access control group. Reporting groups may belong to many groups. If that happens, this member's value is `null`.

**Note**: See [ID prefixes](https://techdocs.akamai.com/cp-codes/reference/id-prefixes) for guidance on comparing this value with data from PAPI.

accountId.description:
Identifies an account assigned to the CP code.

**Note**: See [ID prefixes](https://techdocs.akamai.com/cp-codes/reference/id-prefixes) for guidance on comparing this value with data from PAPI.

contracts.description: Provides detailed information about the contracts assigned to the CP code.

items.description: Specifies details of a single contract.

contractId.description:
Identifies the contract.

**Note**: See [ID prefixes](https://techdocs.akamai.com/cp-codes/reference/id-prefixes) for guidance on comparing this value with data from PAPI.

cpcodeId.description:
Identifies the CP code.

**Note**: See [ID prefixes](https://techdocs.akamai.com/cp-codes/reference/id-prefixes) for guidance on comparing this value with data from PAPI.

cpcodeName.description: The descriptive label for the CP code.

defaultTimezone.description: The default GMT time zone assigned to the CP code.

overrideTimezone.description: The GMT time zone that overrides the default time zone assigned to the CP code. Only a few legacy reports override the default time zone for the time axis. Most reports, and all new ones, use the user's own time zone for the time axis.

timezoneValue.description: The offset value for the GMT time zone.

products.description: A collection of products and services assigned to the CP code.

items.description: Specifies details of a single product.

productId.description:
Identifies a product or service.

**Note**: See [ID prefixes](https://techdocs.akamai.com/cp-codes/reference/id-prefixes) for guidance on comparing this value with data from PAPI.

productName.description: The descriptive label for a product or service.

purgeable.description: Whether you can purge the content cached by the CP code.

type.description: Whether the CP code supports serving traffic from `China`, or `Regular` traffic elsewhere.

schema.description: Provides detailed information about a failed request.

code.description: A descriptive code that corresponds to overall HTTP status.

details.description: Each array member object encodes context for the failed request. For example, malformed query parameter field values.

code.description: A descriptive identifier for each problem.

data.description: A loosely structured object that, when available, encapsulates the set of erroneous input values.

incidentId.description: A logging key useful when communicating about problems with Technical Support representatives.

title.description: A descriptive title that labels each error case.

parameters.description: Identifies the contract to filter data by. Include this optional parameter to narrow down the results to a specific contract only.
parameters.name: contractId

parameters.description: Identifies the access group to filter data by. Include this optional parameter to narrow down the results to a specific access group only.
parameters.name: groupId

parameters.description: Identifies the product or service to filter data by. Include this optional parameter to narrow down the results to a specific product only.
parameters.name: productId

parameters.description: The name of the CP code to filter data by. Include this optional parameter to narrow down the results to a specific CP code name only.
parameters.name: cpcodeName

parameters.description: For customers who manage more than one account, this [runs the operation from another account](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/manage-many-accounts-with-one-api-client). The Identity and Access Management API provides a [list of available account switch keys](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam-api/reference/get-client-account-switch-keys).
parameters.name: accountSwitchKey

get.description: Get a watermark limit for CP codes for a specific contract within your account. For more details, see [Rate and resource limiting](https://techdocs.akamai.com/cp-codes/reference/rate-and-resource-limiting).

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's CP Codes and Reporting Groups API

200.description: Provides the current number of resources and available limit.

schema.description: Provides watermark limits for CP codes or reporting groups within a specific contract.

currentCapacity.description: The current number of CP codes or reporting groups.

limit.description: The number of allowed CP codes or reporting groups.

limitType.description: Identifies whether the `limit` applies to an account or a contract. For more details, see [Rate and resource limiting](https://techdocs.akamai.com/cp-codes/reference/rate-and-resource-limiting).

get.description: Get detailed information about a specific CP code. The details include the CP code type, name, time zone, as well as the account, contracts, and products it's assigned to. This operation also lists the access control group the CP code belongs to.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's CP Codes and Reporting Groups API

schema.description: Provides detailed information about a CP code.

accessGroup.description: A group that controls access to specific CP codes.

put.description: Modifies a specific CP code. After running the [GET a CP code](https://techdocs.akamai.com/cp-codes/reference/get-cpcode) operation, use the response to build a request body. You can only modify a CP code's name, time zone, and purgeable member.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's CP Codes and Reporting Groups API

schema.description: Contains the request members that you can specify when updating a CP code. You should only modify a CP code's name, time zone, and purgeable member. Modifying other members results in a 400 error response and causes the request to fail.

accessGroup.description: A group that controls access to specific CP codes.

contractId.description:

items.description: Specifies details of a single product.

post.description: Creates a reporting group. Make sure the reporting group's name is unique within an account. The `location` header in the response provides a relative path to the created reporting group.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's CP Codes and Reporting Groups API

schema.description: Provides the request members that you can specify when creating a reporting group.

accessGroup.description: A group that controls access to specific CP codes.

contractId.description:
Identifies the contract assigned to the access control group. Get and store this ID from your account using the [Contracts API](https://techdocs.akamai.com/contract-api/reference/get-contract-ids).

**Note**: See [ID prefixes](https://techdocs.akamai.com/cp-codes/reference/id-prefixes) for guidance on comparing this value with data from PAPI.

groupId.description:
Identifies the access control group. Reporting groups may belong to many groups. If that happens, this member's value is `null`.

**Note**: See [ID prefixes](https://techdocs.akamai.com/cp-codes/reference/id-prefixes) for guidance on comparing this value with data from PAPI.

contracts.description: A collection of contracts and CP codes assigned to the reporting group.

items.description: Specifies details of a single contract and collection of CP codes assigned to the reporting group.

contractId.description:
Identifies the contract assigned to the reporting group.

**Note**: See [ID prefixes](https://techdocs.akamai.com/cp-codes/reference/id-prefixes) for guidance on comparing this value with data from PAPI.

cpcodes.description: A collection of CP codes assigned to the reporting group.

items.description: Specifies details of a single CP code.

cpcodeId.description:
Identifies a CP code.

**Note**: See [ID prefixes](https://techdocs.akamai.com/cp-codes/reference/id-prefixes) for guidance on comparing this value with data from PAPI.

cpcodeName.description: The descriptive label for the CP code.

reportingGroupName.description: The descriptive label for the reporting group.

201.description: Provides details of a newly created reporting group.

schema.description: On GET, provides detailed information about a specific reporting group. On PUR, provides the request members that you can specify when updating a reporting group. When updating a reporting group, you should only modify a reporting group's name and assigned CP codes. Modifying other members results in an 400 error response and causes the request to fail.

accessGroup.description: A group that controls access to specific CP codes.

contractId.description:
Identifies the contract assigned to the access control group. Get and store this ID from your account using the [Contracts API](https://techdocs.akamai.com/contract-api/reference/get-contract-ids).

**Note**: See [ID prefixes](https://techdocs.akamai.com/cp-codes/reference/id-prefixes) for guidance on comparing this value with data from PAPI.

groupId.description:
Identifies the access control group. Reporting groups may belong to many groups. If that happens, this member's value is `null`.

**Note**: See [ID prefixes](https://techdocs.akamai.com/cp-codes/reference/id-prefixes) for guidance on comparing this value with data from PAPI.

contracts.description: A collection of contracts and CP codes assigned to the reporting group.

items.description: Specifies details of a single contract and collection of CP codes assigned to the reporting group.

contractId.description:
Identifies the contract assigned to the reporting group.

**Note**: See [ID prefixes](https://techdocs.akamai.com/cp-codes/reference/id-prefixes) for guidance on comparing this value with data from PAPI.

cpcodes.description: A collection of CP codes assigned to the reporting group.

items.description: Specifies details of a single CP code.

cpcodeId.description:
Identifies a CP code.

**Note**: See [ID prefixes](https://techdocs.akamai.com/cp-codes/reference/id-prefixes) for guidance on comparing this value with data from PAPI.

cpcodeName.description: The descriptive label for the CP code.

reportingGroupName.description: The descriptive label for the reporting group.

Location.description: The relative path to the created reporting group.

get.description: Lists detailed information about reporting groups available for your account and contract.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's CP Codes and Reporting Groups API

200.description: Lists details of reporting groups available for a specified account and contract.

schema.description: Provides details about the reporting groups available for your contract.

groups.description: A set of reporting groups available for your contract.

items.description: On GET, provides detailed information about a specific reporting group. On PUR, provides the request members that you can specify when updating a reporting group. When updating a reporting group, you should only modify a reporting group's name and assigned CP codes. Modifying other members results in an 400 error response and causes the request to fail.

accessGroup.description: A group that controls access to specific CP codes.

contractId.description:
Identifies the contract assigned to the access control group. Get and store this ID from your account using the [Contracts API](https://techdocs.akamai.com/contract-api/reference/get-contract-ids).

**Note**: See [ID prefixes](https://techdocs.akamai.com/cp-codes/reference/id-prefixes) for guidance on comparing this value with data from PAPI.

groupId.description:
Identifies the access control group. Reporting groups may belong to many groups. If that happens, this member's value is `null`.

**Note**: See [ID prefixes](https://techdocs.akamai.com/cp-codes/reference/id-prefixes) for guidance on comparing this value with data from PAPI.

contracts.description: A collection of contracts and CP codes assigned to the reporting group.

items.description: Specifies details of a single contract and collection of CP codes assigned to the reporting group.

contractId.description:
Identifies the contract assigned to the reporting group.

**Note**: See [ID prefixes](https://techdocs.akamai.com/cp-codes/reference/id-prefixes) for guidance on comparing this value with data from PAPI.

cpcodes.description: A collection of CP codes assigned to the reporting group.

items.description: Specifies details of a single CP code.

cpcodeId.description:

**Note**: See [ID prefixes](https://techdocs.akamai.com/cp-codes/reference/id-prefixes) for guidance on comparing this value with data from PAPI.

data.description: A loosely structured object that, when available, encapsulates the set of erroneous input values.

incidentId.description: A logging key useful when communicating about problems with Technical Support representatives.

title.description: A descriptive title that labels each error case.

schema.description: Provides detailed information about a failed request.

code.description: A descriptive code that corresponds to overall HTTP status.

parameters.description: For customers who manage more than one account, this [runs the operation from another account](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/manage-many-accounts-with-one-api-client). The Identity and Access Management API provides a [list of available account switch keys](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam-api/reference/get-client-account-switch-keys).
parameters.name: accountSwitchKey

parameters.description: The identifier for the reporting group.
parameters.name: reportingGroupId
